article:
'Genetic transmission' is the transfer of genetic information from genes to
another generation (from parent to offspring), almost synonymous with heredity, [http://medical-
dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/Genetic+lines medical-
dictionary.thefreedictionary.com --> heredity] Retrieved on June 24, 2009
or from one location in a cell to another.

It should not be confused with chromosomal translocation, which is rearrangement
of parts between non-homologous chromosomes.

It should also not be confused with horizontal gene transfer, a process in which
an organism incorporates genetic material from another organism without being
the offspring of that organism.
